Comments_List: This was a great course for learning more about techniques of weaving and identifying types of fabric patterns. Although the class focused on Asian textiles, the skills we learned can be applied to textiles from other parts of the world as well.
Knowledge of the various textile weaving techniques, painting, dying, printing, and other decorative techniques, visual and material analysis of cloth
It was very useful to have hands-on sessions in the YUAG where we could study examples and practice identification

Strengths: Opportunity to closely study primary sources (textiles)
availability of professor,knowlegeability of professor

Weaknesses: Less time for discussion
Yes, absolutely. Useful for students of material culture and Asian art alike.
